definition: to do all one can/to give all one has
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: For whom, for whom, who has waited for eternity in a thousand years?
sentences.chinese: 为谁倾尽一生，为谁把千年等待刻成一个永恒？

sentences.english: All the money in the world cannot bring back yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 倾尽世上所有的金钱也无法挽回昨天。

sentences.english: A systematic approach with a good friend or therapist can help you buckle down.
sentences.chinese: 和一个好朋友或治疗者能帮助你倾尽全力去努力。

sentences.english: "We are working very, very hard on the hybrid Ferrari, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “我们正在倾尽全力地设计混合型法拉利，”他说。

sentences.english: For that one needs to make an effort. The transformation will only happen then.
sentences.chinese: 为此必须倾尽权利为转变由此发生。

sentences.english: The euro area threw everything it could at the crisis this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 在上周末的欧元危机中，整个欧元区已经倾尽全力。

sentences.english: We should pay whatever it takes to get him or at least try.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该倾尽全力把他买过来，试着买也好。

sentences.english: Professor Li Liangyu always makes great efforts and shows unusual ingenuity in his supervision of Ph. D. candidates in writing dissertations.
sentences.chinese: 李良玉教授指导博士论文，倾尽全力，独具匠心。

sentences.english: A: Doing my best for your company.
Give your all to the life that you live.
sentences.chinese: 倾尽全力地过你的生活。

sentences.english: We all come to do our best without expecting any reward or anything.
sentences.chinese: 我们来到这里倾尽全力而不期求回报或其他什么的。

sentences.english: To find, even the best of all, the cape.
sentences.chinese: 去找，哪怕倾尽所有，海角天涯。

sentences.english: "We must do everything we can to help people into a job, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须倾尽所有地帮助人们就业“他表示。

sentences.english: No anesthesia is considered minor. Every case of anesthesia is to be handled with our best effort.
sentences.chinese: 没有小麻醉，对待每一例麻醉我们都必须倾尽全力。

definition: to use up/to exhaust
to use up entirely
all one's life/lifetime
to exhaust/to use up completely
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to throw into
heart's blood/expenditure (for some project)/meticulous care
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
mental and physical efforts
to do one's utmost
to hold nothing back/without reservation
to empty one's pocket/to give everything to help sb
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to follow orders/to abide by/to obey
